discussion.p: Subclause p1 bullet (1.2) states (among other things):

blockquote.p: […] If the parameter parmN is of a reference type, or of a type that is not compatible with the type that results when passing an argument for which there is no parameter, the behavior is undefined.

discussion.p: Unlike the C standard, the C++ standard has no notion of 'compatible types', thus the meaning of this sentence unclear.
